meanings.definition: A person who presides over a group or event.
meanings.sent1: The prester welcomed everyone to the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The prester led the ceremony with grace and authority.
meanings.sent3: As the prester of the party, he made sure everyone had a good time.
meanings.sent4: She was like a prester of harmony, bringing people together effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The prester's presence commanded respect and attention from all.

meanings.definition: To exert pressure or influence on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She tried to prester her friends into joining her for a hike.
meanings.sent2: The company tried to prester customers into buying their new product.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly prestered his cat to catch the laser dot.
meanings.sent4: The storm prestered the windows with howling winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher prestered the students to finish their assignments on time.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a crinkled or puckered surface.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful prester dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The prester fabric added texture to the design.
meanings.sent3: The prester material felt soft and cozy against her skin.
meanings.sent4: The prester curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The prester upholstery gave the room a luxurious feel.

meanings.sent1: We need to prester if we want to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to prester to finish cooking before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prestered across the yard to hide its acorn.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to prester by as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The river prestered downstream, carrying leaves with it.
